name: Study Workflow MVP - Syllabus, LOs, WRAP Sync
description: Enable end-to-end study workflow: (1) Import syllabus and push to Google Calendar + Google Tasks (School list), (2) Track learning objectives by module with view/checkoff UI, (3) WRAP session ingestion to Obsidian + Anki draft-approve-sync flow.

userStories.title: Syllabus import creates Google Calendar events
userStories.description: When importing a syllabus JSON, class meetings should be pushed to Google Calendar as recurring events
acceptanceCriteria: Syllabus JSON import parses class meeting times and recurrence patterns
Class meetings are pushed to Google Calendar via existing OAuth connection
Events show course name, meeting type (lecture/lab), and location if provided
Recurring events use proper RRULE (e.g., weekly until semester end)
Calendar UI shows the synced events after import
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Syllabus import creates Google Tasks for deadlines
userStories.description: Assignments, exams, and quizzes from syllabus should become Google Tasks in the 'School' list
acceptanceCriteria: Identify or create a 'School' task list in Google Tasks
Syllabus items with type assignment/exam/quiz create tasks with due dates
Task title includes course code and item name
Task notes include weight/points if available
Tasks appear in Google Tasks after import
Duplicate guard: skip tasks that already exist with same title and due date
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Learning Objectives API endpoints
userStories.description: REST API for CRUD operations on learning objectives, organized by module
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/learning-objectives returns LOs grouped by course and module
GET /api/learning-objectives?courseId=X filters by course
POST /api/learning-objectives creates new LO with course_id, module_id, title, lo_code
PATCH /api/learning-objectives/:id updates status, next_action
DELETE /api/learning-objectives/:id removes LO
Status values: not_started, in_progress, review_needed, mastered
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Learning Objectives UI - view and checkoff
userStories.description: Brain page section showing LOs organized by module with status checkboxes
acceptanceCriteria: Brain page has 'Learning Objectives' section (collapsible panel)
LOs grouped by course, then by module
Each LO shows title, lo_code, current status
Click to cycle status: not_started -> in_progress -> review_needed -> mastered
Filter by course dropdown
Add new LO form (course, module, title, optional code)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Anki card draft review and sync
userStories.description: Review WRAP-extracted cards in UI, approve them, and sync to Anki via AnkiConnect
acceptanceCriteria: Brain page shows 'Card Drafts' section with pending cards
Each card shows front/back preview, source session, status
Approve button marks card for sync
Reject button removes draft
Sync button sends approved cards to Anki via AnkiConnect (localhost:8765)
Cards go to deck 'PT_Study' with tags from session topic
Status updates: draft -> approved -> synced
Error handling if Anki not running or deck missing
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Bulk LO import from syllabus or paste
userStories.description: Import learning objectives in bulk from a course syllabus or pasted list
acceptanceCriteria: Brain Ingestion tab has 'Import Learning Objectives' option
Accepts JSON format with course_id, module assignments, and LO titles
Accepts plain text list (one LO per line, auto-assigns to selected course/module)
Preview before import showing parsed LOs
Creates LO records with not_started status
Typecheck passes
